name: The Answer is a Number Trivia Quiz | By The Numbers | 10 Questions

questions.text: What number Downing Street is the official residence of the Chancellor of the Exchequer?
questions.explanation:
11.

	Officially, the Chancellor lives at number 11.

questions.text: How many deadly sins are there?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Seven: anger, envy, lust, sloth, avarice, gluttony and pride.

questions.text: How many types of chess pieces are there in a standard set?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Six types: King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Rook and Pawn.

questions.text: How many boroughs in New York?
questions.explanation:
5.

	Five: Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, Staten Island and the Bronx.

questions.text: Which day of July is Bastille Day in France?
questions.explanation:
14.

	The 14 July commemorates the storming of the Bastille prison, which symbolises the start of the French Revolution.

questions.text: How many players in a football (soccer) team are on the field at once?
questions.explanation:
11.

	There are also 11 players in a cricket team.

questions.text: What is the atomic number of Oxygen (its place on the Periodic Table of the Elements)?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Oxygen is 8, Hydrogen is 1, Nitrogen is 7 and Phosphorus is 15.

questions.text: How many Nobel prizes are awarded each year, including the memorial prize?
questions.explanation:
6.

	Six: physics, chemistry, medicine, literature and peace. Economics is a memorial prize.

questions.text: How many steps in the John Buchan thriller?
questions.explanation:
39.

	'The Thirty-Nine Steps' is a classic thriller which has been filmed three times.

questions.text: How many times did a German city (West, East or Unified) host the summer Olympic Games in the 20th Century?
questions.explanation:
2.

	Twice: The Games were held in Berlin in 1936 and in Munich in 1972.
